snippet: The airplane-seat debate has become a bit of an aviation crisis, so maybe it’s time for Congress to take up the issue.
abstract: Gail Collins Op-Ed column imagines how different American political leaders would react to reclining airplane seat in front of them, in light of flight diversions tied to disputes over seat space; suggests that Washington examine issue more closely, as it is only current American affair that is neither frightening nor depressing; laments discomfort on flights has become inevitable.
lead_paragraph: The airplane-seat debate has become a bit of an aviation crisis, so maybe it’s time for Congress to take up the issue.
